item.title: Coronavirus: US hits record high in daily cases
item.description: More than 40,000 infections recorded in a day as surge prompts some states to halt reopenings.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sweden says WHO made 'total mistake' by including it in warning
item.description: Sweden's state epidemiologist says the agency misinterpreted data underpinning alarm over infections.

item.title: Fortnite Movie Nite: Christopher Nolan's hit films screen in-game
item.description: Christopher Nolan's movies play inside Fortnite while his latest film is delayed again.

item.title: 'Stop using our pain to attract black consumers'
item.description: Some brands have been accused of jumping on the Black Lives Matter bandwagon just to sell their products.

item.title: 'Serious' incident shuts down Glasgow city centre
item.description: There is a heavy police presence on West George Street with more than a dozen police vehicles at the scene.

item.title: Man jailed for throwing boy off Tate Modern balcony
item.description: Jonty Bravery threw a six-year-old boy from a 10th floor viewing platform at London's Tate Modern.

item.title: Imran Khan criticised after calling Osama Bin Laden a 'martyr'
item.description: Pakistan's opposition rounds on PM Imran Khan, who said the US "martyred" the 9/11 mastermind.

item.title: Yemen: Coronavirus aid loss 'harming millions of children'
item.description: "Huge shortfalls" in aid due to coronavirus could lead to mass starvation, UN charity warns.

item.title: US House passes 'George Floyd' police reform bill
item.description: The White House has threatened to veto the measure, which Senate Republicans reject as an overreach.

item.title: Obamacare: Trump asks Supreme Court to invalidate Affordable Care Act
item.description: The US president launches a new legal challenge to his predecessor's signature law.

item.title: Coronavirus in Kenya: Police kill three in motorcycle taxi protest
item.description: The police order the arrest of the officers involved, as they come under scrutiny for excessive force.

item.title: When India hosted China amid 1962 war tension
item.description: The recent stand-off in a disputed Himalayan region is not the first time India and China have clashed.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 19-25 June 2020
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: Quiz of the Week: Which tennis stars caught coronavirus?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Huge shark sends surfers fleeing
item.description: A great white shark swimming in Plettenberg Basy, South Africa caused surfers to head to shore.

item.title: Gone with the Wind returns to HBO Max with slavery warning
item.description: The film is reinstated to the HBO Max streaming service with a strong new disclaimer.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Maria Ressa: There is so much at stake for us now
item.description: The award-winning journalist reflects on the future for democracy in the Philippines.

item.title: 'Why I volunteered for coronavirus vaccine trial'
item.description: Kathy is one of about 300 people who will be immunised to help find a vaccine for Covid-19.

item.title: What's the best thing to do with unwanted statues?
item.description: What is the best thing to do with unwanted statues - and is it an option to leave a divisive statue standing?

item.title: George Floyd death: What US police officers think of protests
item.description: Some think change needs to come from the top, others say they are doing a tough job and under attack.

item.title: Fair and Lovely: Can renaming a fairness cream stop colourism?
item.description: Cosmetics giant Unilever agrees to drop “fair” from its Fair and Lovely cream. But is it enough?

item.title: Eurovision: How Ariana Grande's songwriter got involved in Will Ferrell's new movie
item.description: Pop songwriter Savan Kotecha and Swedish singer Molly Sanden are among those who helped make the fictional movie about the Eurovision Song Contest.

item.title: When working from home is much more than emailing
item.description: Some jobs like animating films need more than just regular internet access and robust Wi-Fi.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's happening in Peru?
item.description: Peru has one of the highest case totals and excess death rates in the world - but why?

item.title: Russian parade defies pandemic as Putin stages power bid
item.description: Moscow has moved swiftly out of lockdown and many ask if the president is more worried by a national vote.

item.title: Rethink: Tara Westover says ''Build a world where we can be one people'
item.description: Society must not be divided by class, says author Tara Westover in one of a series of essays for the BBC.

item.title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says 'history not a burden any more' after title win
item.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says "history is no burden any more" after leading the club to their first league title in 30 years.

item.title: Ultimate England Cricketers: Vote in the batting categories
item.description: Who has the best cover drive? Whose power and innovation would you choose? Vote to help build the Ultimate England cricketers.

item.title: Liverpool win Premier League: Reds' 30-year wait for top-flight title ends
item.description: Liverpool's 30-year wait for a top-flight title is over after Manchester City lose 2-1 at Chelsea to confirm the Reds as Premier League champions.

item.title: Djokovic's coach Ivanisevic has coronavirus
item.description: Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic is the latest person involved with the world number one's Adria Tour to test positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Rank the 10 games which have defined Klopp's reign
item.description: BBC Sport looks at 10 games which have shaped Jurgen Klopp's reign at Liverpool as they celebrate winning the Premier League title.

item.title: Raised in the UK - barred from university
item.description: Many immigrant teens grow up feeling "British", only to find that they aren't - and cannot legally work or study.

item.title: Paul Whelan: The strange case of the ex-marine jailed for spying in Russia
item.description: How an ex-US marine ended up with a 16-year prison sentence after Russia accused him of spying.
